DOC.HEADLINE: 2 APPOINTED TO JUDGESHIPS BY WILSON
DOC.TEXT: An Encino attorney and a Westlake Village court commissioner have been appointed judges by Gov . Pete Wilson . George Schiavelli , 45 , of Encino replaces Superior_Court Judge Nora Manella , recently named U.S. attorney for Los Angeles . Schiavelli , who applied for a judge ' s seat with Gov . Wilson ' s office last year , will be paid $ 104 # 262 a year . He is a member of the Los Angeles County Bar Committee on Appellate Evaluations and the Appellate Courts Committee , and has been a partner in the law_firm of Horvitz and Levy since 1986 . Barry Taylor , 51 , of Westlake Village , a superior_court commissioner , was named to the Los Angeles Municipal Court , replacing retired Judge Juaneita Veron . Taylor , who worked in the Los Angeles County public_defenders office from 1967 until going_into private practice in 1990 , will earn $ 95 # 214 a year .
